title: Liverpool keeper Simon Mignolet turns up the heat on Everton ahead of Merseyside derby showdown
text:
Sport Liverpool keeper Simon Mignolet turns up the heat on Everton ahead of Merseyside derby showdown Everton will arrive at Anfield next Saturday in fine form and they have lost just one Premier League game since the last derby Share The banter has already started among the Belgian camp (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Simon Mignolet claims the Merseyside derby banter has already started with Romelu Lukaku and Kevin Mirallas. 
The Liverpool goalkeeper says he has been joking with the Everton duo as they prepare for Belgium's World Cup qualifier against Greece on Saturday. 
Everton will arrive at Anfield next Saturday in fine form and they have lost just one Premier League game since being defeated in the last derby before Christmas. 
Lukaku is the Premier League's top scorer with 21 and Mignolet acknowledges Everton will pose a real threat to Liverpool as the Reds continue their bid for a Champions League spot. Romelu Lukaku is in red-hot form (Photo: REUTERS) 
"I see Romelu Lukaku and Kevin Mirallas every day and it's really nice to talk about it," said Mignolet. 
"We are all together at Liverpool. We're in a good place, and we have to keep that going until the end of the season. 
"Everton are playing very well at the moment, but it's very important for us to take the three points at Anfield." 
Mignolet, 29, is enjoying being Liverpool's No 1 again after losing his place to Loris Karius earlier in the season. Read More Gillette Soccer Saturday icon Jeff Stelling ready to retire after glittering broadcast career Kevin Mirallas will be attempting to put one past Mignolet (Photo: REUTERS) 
He has started every Premier League game since being recalled by Jurgen Klopp in mid-December, but insists the team is more important than him or Karius. 
"I want to play every week," the former Sunderland keeper told Sky Sports News HQ. 
"When you're on the bench, it's disappointing. That's normal. But I do my best in training and then it's down to performances on the pitch. 
"But in the end individuals are not important, it's about the club." poll loading Who will win the Merseyside derby? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
